title: HESTA invests in healthcare and aged-care assets
text:
Industry super fund HESTA has joined the push in the alternate property assets, with a $200 million equity commitment to healthcare and aged care real estate.

The super fund manages $51 billion and has given a $200 million mandate to ISPT to set up the HESTA Healthcare Property Trust which will invest into private hospitals, general medical and residential aged care.

“We are actively looking for investment opportunities as Australia’s ageing population will see the need for a significant expansion in services and facilities in the coming years,” said chief executive Debby Blakey.

HESTA manages super funds for those working in the health and community services. The decision to shift capital into healthcare assets is driven by the returns available in the growing property class and is part of the fund's broader allocation to real estate.

Around 30 per cent of HESTA's overall portfolio is tied up in unlisted assets, with a little under one third of that allocation going into property.

The new mandate with ISPT is the first sector-specific allocation HESTA has placed, according to Andrew Major, its general manager for unlisted assets.
